channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

Stockwell Lane on junction of Beverley Gardens Woodmancote.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Stockwell Lane, Tewkesbury

item.description:
various issues with bridleway - see attached
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 16th August
item.description:
Tree cut without consent of customer.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Incomplete Repair, 16th August
item.description:
This pothole / sinkhole was reported some time ago, as the cones placed around it were reducing the road width so much that vehicles were in danger of meeting head on. This week, workmen dug a load of soil etc out of the hole, coned it off and haven’t been seen since. So the hazard is now worse than it was due ti a bigger hole with more cones around it. Why start the work and then just vanish without a trace? Surely it’s not that complicated to fill a hole in?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road East, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 16th August
item.description:
This tree is becoming very dangerous. It's the largest tree in the street, and the branches overhang our drive way as well as the house on the opposite side of the road. The tree is interfering with the electricity cables overhead, and the roots are now pushing up our pathway towards the house. The branches that have been falling are large, and it's lucky that they haven't hurt someone or caused damage to any cars yet.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven road surface needs filling, 16th August
item.description:
Hazard to cyclists causing steering and reduction in movement while entering Suffolk Road from the Tivoli Circus junction. See photos.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 92, Suffolk Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
email regarding project TTRO - see attached

item.title: Blocking visibility on road/junction (Grass/verge) problem, 16th August
item.description:
Have not been cleared, except for a short stretch from the A46 roundabout to Witcombe village green. The rest of the road from there up to the A417 bypass bridge has not been touched.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 16th August
item.description:
Pothole in road, customer reports it caused a relative to come off their bike
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 16th August
item.description:
Two signs on Andover Road advertising and prewarning of Marathon coming up, have fallen down and are now laid on the footpath. This is making it difficult to use the footpath due to its narrow size. This is particularly impacting Mothers with prams and Children, as well as mobility scooters, pushing people to use the carriageway to get down the road.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 16th August
item.description:
Customer reported that verges are overgrown on this lane, forcing pedestrians onto road. There are also overgrown trees which are also making the lane impassable. Please can this be addressed.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Broken glass on pavement, 16th August
item.description:
Broken glass on pavement: hazard to pedestrians, especially children, and animals. Thanks for dealing with this.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23a, Pittville Street, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 16th August
item.description:
Tree on the verge outside home has gotten so big customer is concerned in bad it may fall, and is very close to their home, but also close to carriageway if it falls in the opposite direction.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This drain and the next one down Station road are blocked, 16th August
item.description:
These drains in Church road and Station road have been blocked for several years. I spoke to some workers a few weeks ago who looked like they were going to clear the drain, but they failed. I don't know if they reported the issue back.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 16th August
item.description:
Cover missing from school 20mph sign, will be made safe by Ringway TM Can this please be passed onto Street Lighting for further investigation and repair.

item.title: Street lighting, 16th August
item.description:
The street light is not working on the entrance to Glynbridge gardens by the bridge. Second street light is not working in the conifers of 1 Patterdale Close
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Glynbridge Gardens, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Muddy mess, 16th August
item.description:
Due to cars parking on the verge during school runs the verge is now ruined containing large holes and mud with all grass being killed off. It would make sense to tarmac and level this area to make the footpath better but to also include school “pencil” bollards to stop cars parking on the verge.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Bedford Avenue, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Birch tree trim back, 16th August
item.description:
Low hanging leaves and branches need trimming back to enable pedestrians to walk freely. Branches are blocking street light particularly on windy days Growth is surrounding overhead telephone cabling to local properties
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 46, Dorset Avenue, Rowanfield, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree stump outside Mira Showers, has become a public bin and the verge cannot be maintained around it. Please resolve what is supposed to only be a temporary safety measure., 15th August
item.description:
